dict.string: Welcome to the Indian Residential School History and Dialogue Centre. We welcome your feedback on this space. If you have any questions or comments, please reach out to a staff member.

Throughout the entire installation, colours are consistent. Blue items indicate residential schools. pink items indicate events, green items indicate organizations and purple items indicate artifacts.
Tapping a pin, dragging the timeline, or pinching the map are great ways to get started exploring the installation.
When you begin moving the map, the timeline, or interacting with the nodes, the installation will automatically create an individual session for you.
If you are working alone with the installation, the aeshtetic layer may move across all screens. The installation will continuously divide down into a maximum of six individual sessions.
You can move around the map, or the timeline, by touching and dragging a finger across the screen. On the node visualizer, you can drag elements around.

Tap a pin on the map, a flag on the timeline, or a element on the node visualizer to select. In the timeline and map layers this will open a record, on the node visualizer this will put focus on that node.
To zoom in to or out of the map you can pinch with two fingers. The timeline and node visualizer do not have the ability to zoom.

Records provide a concise, interactive window for learning and exploring. Records are made up of a media viewer, a scrollable text view, and a set of related records (if available). You can move a record by dragging in its header bar.
To reveal related records, tap on the plus icon (+) in the upper right hand corner of the window – some records do not have related items.
You can filter related records by: images, organizations, events, and artifacts. To do so, tap on one of the small icons just above the scrollview.
Most records will have an image, you can tap on the thumbnail to view it in more detail. If a record has many thumbnails, you can scroll through them before tapping.
Records that represent videos will have a visible play icon. To open a video player, simply tap the media viewer thumbnail.
To play or pause, you can either tap the icon in the bar at the bottom of the video window or tap the video itself.
You can adjust the volume by tapping on the icon in the bottom right corner of the viewer.
You can move forwards or backwards through video content by dragging the scrubber in either direction along the control bar.
An alternative way to find records is through the browse menu.
The browse menu is divided into high-level categories such as: Events, Artefacts, Organizations, Schools and Themes.

To begin, tap the browse button in the User Menu. Then, choose a top-level category for your search. A second tier with ranges will open – for example, Schools are ranged by Province. There are 2-3 tiers for any top-level category.
Once you’ve hit the last tier for a category, tapping on any entry will open a record.
